name: Alert flow through Alertmanager.txt - Components involved in Alert flow
description: This section explains the various components involved in the alert flow process at Razorpay. It outlines the tools and services used for monitoring, alerting, and incident management. The workflow starts with creating alert rules in a GitHub repository, which are then picked up by monitoring tools like Vmalert and Victoriametrics. These tools evaluate the rules and send alerts to Alertmanager, which routes them to Pagerduty for notification. An incident bot in Slack facilitates communication and collaboration during incidents.
use_cases: Monitoring system metrics and detecting anomalies
Routing alerts to the appropriate teams
capabilities: Integration with GitHub, Pagerduty, and Slack

name: Alert flow through Alertmanager.txt - Alertmanager workflow
description: This section explains the workflow of the Alertmanager, which is a component responsible for managing alerts generated by monitoring systems like Prometheus. It describes how alerts are evaluated, routed, and sent to various notification channels like Slack, PagerDuty, and custom webhooks based on predefined rules and labels. The section also covers the integration with PagerDuty services, escalation policies, and the role of the Incident Bot in parsing alerts and notifying stakeholders.
use_cases: Routing alerts to different notification channels (Slack, PagerDuty, custom webhooks) based on alert labels and rules
Mapping alerts to PagerDuty services and triggering escalation policies for notification
Parsing alert information and notifying stakeholders using the Incident Bot
Configuring central dashboard alerts and notifying the Incident Management team and tech support team
capabilities: Alert notification channels (Slack, PagerDuty, custom webhooks)
PagerDuty service mapping and escalation policies
Incident Bot for alert parsing and stakeholder notification
Central dashboard alert configuration and notification
